Bad Game.  You have to pay for... almost everything, obvious Agar.io ripoff. In my opinion, this game is bad, i only got to play once for 1 minute (literally 1 MINUTE, 60 seconds, how short is that!?) until the game froze completely, when i restarted and opened the game, the screen was blank, nothing, BLANK, and it stayed like this until now, that i uninstalled it. They didn't even bother in changing the way of the title, not even a little.  (Agar.io/Mitos.is , you can note the dot, obvious details, etc.)  The game isn't less laggy than Agar.io, the problem is that when you open an .exe file from your computer it will run depending on the performance of YOUR computer, your CPU, RAM, etc.  On the other side, Agar.io is more 'Laggy' because Agar.io runs on a WEB BROWSER, instead of Mitos.is, that runs from steam/desktop/program/whatever etc.  Agar.io is a more simple game than Mitos.is, which makes Agar.io a much better game. For example:  In Agar.io, you play as a simple cell, with the only pourpouse to eat, form, and get to the top of the leaderboard. In Mitos.is, you play as a cell, with the only pourpouse to get coins, wait for loadings, adjust your settings for better performance, pay the title screen, pay the loadings, pay everything.   Mitos.is, the popular Agar.io ripoff only on steam, it will empty your wallet.  Mitos.is is a bad game, almost as fun as Agar.io, but worst. Rating: 3/10|Next time try harder! Oh and, for all you people reading this, Mitos.is is a PAY2WIN.

Mitos.is is a game in which you play a cell, consuming other, near-identical, cells. However, it itself is a straight-up clone of another, near-identical game, Agar.io.  It is in this mindless consumption of your faceless equals that the game reflects not only itself and Freakinware, but every other attempt at cloning Agar.io. It consumes and absorbs everything Agar.io is, was, and will likely ever be, in a mindless bid to fuel it's own growth, and become the biggest fish in the pond. As it tries to devour and conquer, it is opposed by countless others vying for the exact same goal. Each as pitiless, remorseless, and fearless as itself, purely driven by the id. And yet, despite the goal of growth, no true growth or progress can ever be made. No matter how big one grows, they still continue to hunt the same objective, never satisfied, never accomplished.  As far as one may have physically grown, there is no mental development, no questions. No whys. In leaving behind their mental abilities in the pursuit of growth, they have become exactly as Freakinware are. No interest in the cultural or philsophical, no interest in becoming something more than they are. They only care about being the biggest circle on the screen. A mindless number in a sea of mindless numbers.

Alright, now, I'm going to try to make this short. TL;DR is at the bottom.   Comparing It to Agar.io  Yes, it's an Agar.io rip-off, but it has added features. It's much more responsive, detailed, interesting, and comes with default music and sound effects. The principle of Mitos.is is exactly the same to Agar.io, but like I said, they've spiced it up a little bit.   What's Added/New to It?  Here I'll go more in-depth.  It's more responsive. A hell of a lot more. Agar.io revolves around you getting lucky whether the website would actually detect your mouses' location or not, and Mitos.is fixes that. It's so much easier to squeeze yourself out of sticky situations and catch people out.  They've kept the skins. But you have to level up to  earn  them. I'm not too sure what I think of that. On Agar.io, it's nice to be able to just pick your skin and boom, there you have it, and Mitos.is lacks that. But at the same time, isn't it nice to wear a skin that you've  earned ?  Sound Effects and Music. That's what Agar.io really, really lacked. Yes, sure, you can download mods for it and all, but why not have it there anyway without some tacky browser add-on? Lovely, isn't it? Mitos.is' music is also 10x better than the Agar.io modded ones. Bleugh.   TL;DR  ~ It's Agar.io with better graphics and motion control with ranking, leaderboards, leveling up, music and sound effects. 7/10   EDIT  Well. I have to pay to continue? 3/10.

Mitos.is is a nice free game in which you can hop in, play a bit, and jump back out at your leisure. Play a few minutes in between other things, or have a few hours to spend trying to get big, either way works.  The gameplay is basic, but solid. You spawn as a circle/cell and you collect little things laying around to get bigger. Once you are big enough, you can eat smaller players by running into them. Games with this premise date back litterally as long as I've been alive, and probably further back as well. As for this one, the bigger you are, the slower. So you can avoid the bigger players while gathering your own mass, and then come back to take them out instead. You can split yourself in two for a speed boost and control both orbs to chase down your prey, and then you can keep splitting yourself again and again if you want to. Of course, being smaller like that means there is the risk that someone bigger than you comes by and eats up part of your cell, and you'll have to keep on running to avoid them. That said, you can use the speedboost to run as well, when things are too bleak to stand for them, yet you want to not lose it all, leaving behind part of your collected mass may be preferable to losing it all. There are also virus nodes, and eating those will burst you into smaller chunks. You can use this by throwing a part of your mass through these and then onto your opponent, thus giving you an easier snack.   Mitos.is comes with multiple game modes, including free for all, teams, CTF, and guild based modes. One thing I initially disliked was that FFA servers included people teaming up at times, but after a few more times playing I ended up realising how good this actually was for the tactics available in the game.  Once you're large, you may attract someone else who is a lot smaller. Sure, you could throw a whole lot of your mass over at him, eat his tiny amount of mass, and be vulnerable to bigger blobs coming to get you...Or you could not. Just let him stay around near you, buzzing around you and growing bigger in safety as you scare away (Or eat) anything that preys on the little guy. Then in turn, when someone bigger than you comes by, the small guy you've been protecting may throw his own mass at you to allow you to overcome the threat. And if you then throw back some to your new friend, both of you profit. I'm fairly sure this is how the first monkey-like creatures decided to start living together, and it works. Teaming up can arise organically, and there is nothing wrong with that. Just advanced survival tactics   Mitos.is is a simple but good game, it's easy to pick up, easy to put down, and varied enough to keep you playing it and coming back occasionally. It's small size and price of 'free' makes it hard to justify not giving it a try, but do not expect too much, it's not some deep masterpiece or complicated puzzle, it's just something nice for you to enjoy until you grow tired of it

Mitos.is: The Game, (I will call it Mitos.is), Is a free-to-play, 2D, massively multiplayer, indie game VERY similar to Agar.io. The game is bassically Agar.io, but different, with it's own achivements, a whole lot more skins, and power-ups.  Mitos.is has much more than 3 game modes. In fact, it has 6 different game modes. My personal favorite is Free-For-All. The game also features a level system, where the bigger you are, the higher place you are, and the longer you last, get you more EXP. Levels show other online players how skilled you are, and let you purchase more items/power-ups. Items in the game will help you in different ways. To get these items, you need coins, which you get from doing the daily rewards, collecting them around the map, and getting achivements. Achivements in-game act as a purpose to playing the game, so to speak. And, last but not least, there multiple different skins to choose from, and you make your own skin, with the right amount of coins, that is.  Overall, this is a great game, and I really do recommend it. You will get more steam hours, and it is A LOT easier to play with friends and family, than playing Agar.io.

According to what I've seen, there's:  Feeders (Feed mass to others; whether it be team or enemy. Usually stick close to defenders or friendly predators. They like all game modes, and always hang in Random Team, as well as CTF. They are a dying species, and are smaller in size, might I add. Lots are left but aren't too common. I am personally a feeder.)  Defenders (Use their large cells to defend team mates, and the flag depending on the game mode. They are seen in all game modes, and are very common.)  Predators (Prey upon smaller cells; Most are hostile. They sometimes respect the Feeders peace if they get mass. They tend to hang out in All for One, Guild Wars and Random Team. They tend to stay away from CTF considering it has a different goal than to survive and kill. They are very common.)  Peaceful players (Don't eat others; prefer to stay away from large crowds. They may sometimes be seen in All For One mode and Random Team. Hardly even a category anymore. They are smaller in size, like a feeder. They are dying out.)  Hostiles (Oh boy.. Well. The name speaks for itself. They are ruthless. Many still litter the population, and it's hard to pin point them. They are a lot like a Predator, but do not respect feeding boundaries. They DO NOT respect others either. If you kill one, you bet your ♥♥♥ they'll come and hunt you down like a dragon hunting for a measely chicken. Beware of these. They are seen in all game-modes, and WILL kill you. Steer clear of these beasts.)  I rate the game 10/10. It's amazing, and I don't understand why it doesn't have more positive views. People who say it's a copy of some other game only dowloaded it to hate. Take your hate speech elsewhere. This game is overall better, and anyone who is new and wants more info, go ahead and talk with me.  **EDIT***  I found another kind of player in my adventures!!!  Beggers (Always whining for them to feed them or team up. Annoying, right? Found everywhere. You can't escape this breed. VERY common, there isn't a server or game mode without them.)

I've already spent more than 20 hours on this game, in 10 days. I can't stop myself from playing it, it's addicting. And you know the worse part is? I was an Agario fan since it launched! When I discovered Mitosis, at first I was wondering why someone would rip Agario off in such a patent way. I've tried it, and the more I tried, the more Mitosis provided me a much better playing experience than Agario ever did. It is different. The cells don't behave the same way on both games, the team section on Mitosis is much more efficient (a goal to reach), the map is smaller, we can add people to our friend list and chat with them. And, last but not least, the ranking is better implemented.  I fell in love with Agario, but since I know Mitosis I wonder why I did in the first place!

Remarkably addicting and fun.   Ultra-casual game-modes and even a guild v guild mode that really let you jump in and out and have fun.   The game revolves around a cellular concept where you are a cell consuming bits of DNA to gain mass - you can also eat your fellow players in this MMO, which makes for the real fun. There is a store element to buy items that give your little Cell perks, like initial size boosts, speed boosts, and split perks (Splitting your cell is one of your attacks to consume the enemy, or run away and be harder to eat!)  The controls are simple... Pint in the direction you want your cell to go... Run into stuff you want to eat... run away from stuff trying to eat you. But Dont let the simplistic style lead you to thinking there is no strategy. You can FEED players to make them bigger, giving BIG benefits to team-play. Using friendly cells and sharp obsticles, you can survive... Or can you? In some modes there can be only one...   Honestly, its a fun game to play. Dont expect much in terms of graphics, but for what you get for the norhing I had to pay for it, its honestly one of my go to time killers these days. Its competitive, and fun, and there's no trolling (no ability to chat during play) so eat as much as you like, no one's going to cry about it! :D

Mitosis, as the name suggests is a game loosely based on cell theory (A scientific “theory” that mostly works in practice, as many scientific theory’s do. E.g. - Human Biology & chemistry (medicine), Physics (engines etc.),chemistry (fuel) to name a few of the applied technologies that together make a modern society possible. In the game you play as a cell and increase in size the more stuff you eat ( it looks like D.N.A though a cell users glucose as it's fuel). The cell can divide into exact copies (biology - mitosis). And, like white blood cells (leukocytes ) in the human body, can also eat other cells ( though in the game you target cells that are smaller than your cell). The basic game play is comparably straight forward, however there are many play tactics (and weapons/defences) at your disposal to help you become the largest cell. The games includes several game modes to choose from. These include; Free for all (though there are a few whom play together, which isn't playing to the free for all game ethic. Kind of cheating); Team mode (The mode for playing together!) ;hunger games (20 players start, highest score/size wins, amongst other game modes.   Mitosis is a fun game (I hope the game develops program a linux based version of this game soon.) with a scientific narrative made possible by the appliance of science (computing technology). Though as with most modern technology Mitosis is a game that can also be enjoyed by people whom are comparably scientifically illiterate. For example, people whom have been unfortunate in not having excess to the vast amount of scientific information freely available on the internet( another scientific invention) or/& exist in a scientifically illiterate social bubble where it seems normal not to know any basic science & how science gathers reliable knowledge. Thus, having games/films/music lyrics based on the supported publicly verifiable evidence, can help people learn about objective reality as they play & decrease the level of ignorance in our society.  I hope the game develops program a linux based version of this game soon.

Mitosis was a great game when I first got it. I have played for many hours. But they ruined themselves.  The pay to win system means that you can't play free for all anymore. Level 69's who are geared to the max just eat everyone why feeding each other. You end up with 3-6 level 69s who just cover the entire map and no way to eat them.  They changed the way the other games work now too. Capture the flag resets your size after each flag is captured, which is really jarring and frustrating. Several other levels do this too. I can see why they might want to do it, but it is the worst idea, honestly.  The big problem with this game is it is unbalanced. Once you get to a certain size, no one can hurt you. Even with viruses, they only knock you down so much. The game was amazing, and I would love to keep playing it, but it isn't the game I got anymore.  Also, worm.io is glitchy as hell. I would be willing to play it if it wasn't so arbitrary and messed up. It solves some of the problems that mitosis has in that anyone can kill anyone, but the actual rules are unclear and frustrating.  ALSO, there is no guide on how to play? Like basic stuff like spliting and ejecting? I had to figure it all out by dying a bunch at first. I don't own dark souls for a reason.  TL;DR: Get it 6-8 months ago, and stop playing before the last update. Either that, or just don't get it.

Mitos.is is an interesting idea, but comes of as a copy of agar.io, even in the title.  First, lets look at the plus sides. Music: Its amazing, love it. Fits the tone of the game perfectly. Graphics: Clean and simple, fit the tone of the game well. Game modes: Lots of game modes, all nice variations of the others.  Now, the negitives.  This game is almost a straight copy of Agar.io. It trys to bring in rpg elements like leveling up and the such, but it comes of like its been tacked on to make it seem like its not agar.io, which it is. This game needed to try harder. Maybe they could have make a hub world, where you can hang out with people, but they didn't. They could make it their own, by making this game a different beast than agar.io. They could have went all out with the rpg like gameplay, they could have made this game like a lovechild from WoW and Agar.io, but they didn't, and it made them look like stealing ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. Plus, the servers lag to much.  So, no. dont get this game. Not now, but maybe later, they will go all out with the rpg gameplay, but right now, no,

Pros: - Equipable items to benefit player - Large variety of skins - in-game chat - Large variety of gamemodes - Teaming fatigue in FFA  Cons: - Still lots of teaming in FFA (People bypass the teaming fatigue) - Difficult to gain mass due to people with higher mass constantly consuming you (even when skilled, high level, and anywhere from 30 seconds to 5 minutes before being killed) - Very rare to be on the leaderboard between 1-6 due to large amounts of teaming in FFA - Devs don't take big enough actions against teaming - High level items can cost great amounts of coins - Difficult to obtain high level items  Conclusion:   Have you ever wanted to play a game similar to  Agar.io?  Well, sadly this is not the game for you. This game had lots of potential that was wasted. It could have been even better than Agar.io. This game has lots of teaming in gamemodes not meant for teaming, such as FFA. Also, the fatigue given to the teaming players doesn't stop them nor strong enough of a consiquence. In conclusion, this game is poorly regulated by the Devs, with new gamemodes constantly being added to increase sell rates of coin packages; allowing users to buy items to make it possible to 'win' or become the highest on the leaderboard which without outrageous amounts of coins you are unable to buy.  Last Words:   Don't download this game. It simply is a game created so the company can make quick easy money. Lastly, most of the time people become big or 'win' it's due to teaming, luck with small amounts of skill, or simply having enough skill to pull it off on your own (this is a very rare occasion due to all the others problems with this waste of time game).
